Posts.Content: Nov 30, 2010 10:52PM Pink13 wrote: Sending my love, {{{hugs}}} and prayers for all the Nov. 30th, Dec. 1, 2 and 3rd sisters!!   Thank you takeabreath - I ordered some of those Pink Pockets - they sound like just what I need.  Sharon, I read that whole blog ~ it was so informative and helpful :)  I'm going to see my PS tomorrow and I have a whole list of questions - I can't wait to get answers so I'll quit all the over-thinking about everything. Bless you all!!

I'm not looking forward to this - say a prayer for me - See you on the other side.

Posts.Content: Nov 23, 2010 10:10PM Pink13 wrote: I felt a lot like you - my daughter was telling me to get a second opinion but everything was so new and overwhelming that I couldn't make up my mind how to move forward.  Then it became clear when I saw the Plastic surgeon that the Breast surgeon sent me to - I didn't care for him at all - he didn't tell me anything - was vague and I left there thinking I need a second opinion.  So I ended up finding another surgeon who a friend of mine really liked and also a new plastic surgeon and everything felt just right.  Both were extremely informative - took the time to answer my questions - and treated me well.
Posts.Title: Does everyone get a second opinoin? Ehigs Ehigs

Posts.Content: Nov 16, 2010 10:05AM - edited Aug 20, 2013 04:12AM by Pink13 Megan, I've got a Dec birthday also - 4 days after my surgery!  I hope you decide to have a birthday party before your surgery - that's what I'm planning on .  I am having a BMX with immediate reconstruction with Alloderm and silicone implants.  I'm really happy that the surgeon agreed to it since I've decided to go smaller with a B cup. I found out that my older sister (who was very secretive then) had her breast tissue removed about 15 years ago because she kept having cysts - she had two large ones removed in a 6 month period and decided to just have all her breast tissue removed. More hugs {{{{{ }}}}}
Posts.Title: December 2010 Mastectomy zogo fire-dancer

Posts.Content: Nov 17, 2010 05:14PM Pink13 wrote: I am the first one in my neighborhood that has their Christmas lights up - I'm usually one of the last but I'm determined not to miss Christmas this year.  This weekend I will bring the artificial tree in from  the garage and decorate it up.  Seems weird cause I still have my Thanksgiving decos around - little turkeys, pilgrims and some pumpkins.  When I celebrate my Birthday early maybe I'll call my party a "Goodbye Ta-tas" party - LOL.  Trying to keep my sense of humor isn't easy! Thinking of you all - xoxoMar

Posts.Content: Nov 21, 2010 10:14PM Pink13 wrote: Oh Andrea,  thanks for posting this recliner question.  I think about it every day wondering (since I basically live alone) how I will get out of the chair.  My chair doesn't have the lever BUT you have to push the arms of the chair to recline and sort of pull the arms to sit up SO if I have a BMX and my arms and chest are in pain will I be able to work the chair???  What if I'm trapped?  It's a mystery to me - I have friends who have offered to help me so do I recruit them to sit around and wait for me to need reclined or sat up? LOL p.s.  I put the Christmas tree up today - yahoo!  One more thing to check off the list!
Posts.Title: December 2010 Mastectomy zogo fire-dancer

Posts.Content: Dec 2, 2010 12:00PM Pink13 wrote: Oh Annie ~ I hear you - I feel like I've been waiting an eternity!!!  I have my boobs on my brain 24/7 I saw the PS yesterday for my preop and cleared up my questions - he said I'll probably be a "C" cup (I'm a D now) - that's a surprise cause I thought being a "B" was the largest for immediate reconstruction one step with Alloderm.  And he said instead of the hamburger bun type of incision he's going to try an anchor.  That ought to be interesting. I'm also a worry wart about MRSA in hospitals - my husband got it in the hospital before he passed away and it concerns me. So he gave me a small bottle of Hibiclens to shower with before surgery.
Posts.Title: December 2010 Mastectomy zogo fire-dancer

Posts.Content: Dec 3, 2010 06:39PM Pink13 wrote: Oh Ilene (Takeadeepbreath) - I really relate to your picture of us as skyjumpers LOL - thanks for sharing it!  It seems like I'm always running to the store looking for something else to take to the hospital - I've bought button front jammies and shirts, pink pockets (arrived in the mail today-sooo fast), slippers, Purrell hand sanitizer, lysol wipes, Walmart sports bras, etc. etc. etc. I am also going to take some Arnica Montana tablets starting 3 days bef. surgery and for a week after.  I checked it out with my PS and he said it's okay.  When I had a bletharoplasty recently the PS I had then recommended it for bruising and swelling, so I tried it and everyone commented how great I looked because my eyes had barely any bruising or swelling. I got them at our local Sprouts in their vitamin section. Question:  What is a camelpak? Kind of freaky, isn't it, to think about having your breasts loped off - surreal! At your suggestion I'm taking deep breaths!!!!
Posts.Title: December 2010 Mastectomy zogo fire-dancer

Posts.Content: Dec 23, 2010 01:04PM Pink13 wrote: Hi westieluv - so sorry to hear of all your complications - how are you feeling now?  How long were you in the hospital all together?  So happy with you that all the cancer is out!! Thinking of you Beatingit2 today and wish you a successful outcome. I have a question for you all - got 2 of my 4 drains out last week, but this week I am having too much output for the others to be taken out.  But yesterday and today when emptying them I noticed that the blood was purplish brown instead of the bright red color of the past.  I don't feel sick, don't have a fever so I'm wondering if I should worry about it?  I am exactly 14 days since surgery today.
Posts.Title: December 2010 Mastectomy zogo fire-dancer

Posts.Content: Nov 15, 2010 08:18PM Pink13 wrote: Hi Everybody, I finally got a surgery date - December 9th.  I was hoping for the week of Nov. 29th but it couldn't be worked out.  I found the lump in my left breast on Sept 1st so it seems like a really long time ago with lots of time to be anxious and dream up lots of questions.  BUT on a positive note it gave me lots of time to read everyone's posts here on BC.org and get a valuable education.  Before BC.org I was clueless and didn't even know anyone personally that had Breast Cancer. My hubby passed away 4 years ago so I'm going through this mostly alone.  My kids are grown and are either busy or not that comfortable with talking about BC.  It's so great the support this website affords us - I'm thankful :)  Hugs to you all {{{{ }}}}.
Posts.Title: December 2010 Mastectomy zogo fire-dancer

Posts.Content: Nov 18, 2010 04:24PM - edited Aug 20, 2013 05:13AM by Pink13 How are y'all today?  I just want to whine a little (and no husband anymore to whine to) - my brain seems to be on the "C" word all the time - morning, noon and night.  It dictates everything in my life now - all the uncertainties of the upcoming surgery - even just having surgery and anesthesia gives me the heebie jeebies.  Since I will be coming home alone after surgery friends have asked what help I'll need and I don't even know what to say - I'm the kind of person who doesn't want to be a burden or be needy for anyone - I've always had to do for myself and like it that way.  Ugh!
Posts.Title: December 2010 Mastectomy zogo fire-dancer

Posts.Content: Nov 28, 2010 10:06PM Pink13 wrote: Hi Everyone and Welcome All December Newcomers - Tina, I've been trying to recline my Recliner in and out without using my arms and think my Recliner needs some WD40 on the moving parts.  It's really stiff and won't budge without a strong arm push.  I think I'll turn it over tomorrow and spray it good!  I'm having a pre-op appointment with my PS on Wednesday this week and I have lots more questions.  I'm second-guessing everything now and wish this was all over so I could stop the mind debate. I'm scheduled for immediate reconstruction after the bmx with alloderm and silicone implants.   I will have the dye injected on the 8th for the SNB - I guess they inject it the day before surgery so that it has time to travel to all the lymph nodes.  Well, to quote Miss Piggy - I have so much to do and so little time! Praying for Peace for us all :)
